intro: Polycarpaea paupera, commonly known as the poor carpel plant, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
